definitions: If someone or something exerts influence, authority, or pressure, they use it in a strong or determined way, especially in order to produce a particular effect.
If you exert yourself, you make a great physical or mental effort, or work hard to do something.
to use ( influence, authority, etc) forcefully or effectively
to apply (oneself) diligently; make a strenuous effort
to put forth or use energetically; put into action or use
to apply (oneself) with great energy or straining effort
to put forth or into use, as power; exercise, as ability or influence; put into vigorous action
to put (oneself) into strenuous, vigorous action or effort
